item.title: Snezhinka: Sentinel Girls 2 coming to PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch on February 13
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/snezhinka-sentinel-girls-2-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-and-switch-on-february-13

  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PC.

Publisher PLAYISM and developer hinyari9 will release side-scrolling shooter Snezhinka: Sentinel Girls 2 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch on February 13 for $11.99, the companies announced.

Snezhinka: Sentinel Girls 2 first launched for PC via Steam on August 27, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via PLAYISM:

This is the sequel to Marfusha: Sentinel Girls, the second entry in the series of high-tempo shooting game with simple controls.

Play as Snezhinka, an employee of a private military company in a dystopian world depicted in beautiful 2.5D pixel art. Go to various different battlefields and defend your objectives from the enemy’s onslaught.

Every day you manage to survive will net you a salary, but this goes through all sorts of tax deductions and other payments… and you’ll have to use your meager earnings left over to strengthen yourself, buy new equipment, and recruit coworkers.

In Story Mode, the story changes based on which coworker you choose to fight with. Read every story to their ends over multiple playthroughs.

There are also two different Challenge Modes that both fully support online rankings, as well as a Collection where you can view all sorts of elements you obtain in-game.

The console version comes with the artbook included.

Watch a new trailer below.

Consoles Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: EDEN.schemata(); launches this spring
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/eden-schemata-launches-this-spring

  • PC

Demo playable during Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition.

Science-fiction mystery adventure game EDEN.schemata(); will launch for PC via Steam this spring, ublisher PLAYISM will developers illuCalab. and WSS playground announced. A demo will be available during Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition, which will run from February 24 to March 3.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via PLAYISM:

You awaken in a dark, locked room, only to find a broken android and a headless body…

Investigate every corner of a lab isolated from the world to solve this strange murder mystery.

What you notice will reshape this world, from the premise of the story, to the game itself. Experience a narrative that can only be realized in video game format.

Watch today’s PLAYISM Game Show mini featuring the announcement below.

PLAYISM Game Show mini: January 30, 2025

English

Japanese

Chinese

item.title: BREAK ARTS III launches this spring
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/break-arts-iii-launches-this-spring

  • PC

Demo playable during Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition.

Battle racing and robot customization sequel BREAK ARTS III will launch for PC via Steam this spring, publisher PLAYISM and developer MercuryStudio announced. A demo will be available during Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition, which will run from February 24 to March 3.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via PLAYISM:

The beautiful battle racing game is back, deeper and with more freedom than ever.

Compete in all sorts of stages, each with varying terrain, gravity, and temperature. Achieve victory by designing appropriate machines and piloting them skillfully!

Choose from a wide variety of parts to create and compete with your very own unique machines… or simply admire your creations in Diorama Mode!

Build the fastest, most powerful, and most beautiful machines to compete in racing, battle, and battle racing competitions.

Watch today’s PLAYISM Game Show mini featuring the announcement below.

PLAYISM Game Show mini: January 30, 2025

English

Japanese

Chinese

item.title: Sugoro Quest: Dice Heroes coming to PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, and Switch on February 7
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/sugoro-quest-dice-heroes-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-and-switch-on-february-7

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Technos Japan-developed board game-style turn-based RPG.

Ratalaika Games and Shinyuden, in cooperation with Arc System Works, will release the Technos Japan-developed board game-style turn-based RPG Sugoro Quest: Dice Heroes for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Switch on February 7 for $5.99, the companies announced.

Sugoro Quest: Dice Heroes first launched for Famicom on June 28, 1991 in Japan. This re-release will mark the first-ever time the game will be available in the west, and it will be playable in English, Spanish, and Japanese.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo eShop:

About

Roll the dice and fight!

Sugoro Quest: Dice Heroes comes to the west for the first time! This is a board game-style turn-based RPG where dice will decide your fate!

The story begins in the kingdom of Siland, where four adventurers set out to talk to the king in search of intrepid adventures. Each adventure is different, so be sure to choose the most suitable member for each journey.

A school of magic? An adventure at sea? It’s up to you(and luck, of course) to make sure the adventure has a good ending! But beware of the enemies, as they won’t make your path easy.

Luck will lead you to victory!

Features:

  • Available in English for the first time!
  • Choose from four different heroes, each with their own unique abilities.
  • Explore six lands full of treasures and dangerous monsters.
  • Save state function: save wherever you want to in the game, and restart from that exact point.
  • Screen filters: select from several filters to modify how the game looks (retro-style monitor, black-and-white, etc.).
  • Gallery: view images from the original game’s manual and box design.
  • Cheats function: activate cheats that will make your mission a lot easier (infinite lives, invulnerability, etc.).

item.title: First Elminage port for modern consoles to be announced in mid to late February
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/first-elminage-port-for-modern-consoles-to-be-announced-in-mid-to-late-february

Elminage II possibly the first port in line.

Mebius will announce the first in a series of console ports for the STARFISH-SD-developed dungeon RPG series Elminage in mid to late February, the company teased.

The Elminage series consists of the following titles:

  • Elminage: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods (PS2, 2008)
    • Elminage DS Remix: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods (DS, 2008)
    • Elminage ORIGINAL: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods (PSP, 2011)
    • Elminage ORIGINAL: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods (3DS, 2016)
    • Elminage ORIGINAL: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods (PC, 2017)
  • Elminage II: Twin Goddesses and The Land of Destiny (PSP, 2009)
    • Elminage II DS Remix: Twin Goddesses and The Land of Destiny (DS, 2010)
    • Elminage II: Twin Goddesses and The Land of Destiny (3DS, 2017)
  • Elminage III: Dark Apostle and The Palace of the Sun (PSP, 2011)
    • Elminage III: Dark Apostle and The Palace of the Sun (3DS, 2017)
  • Elminage Gothic (PSP, 2012)
    • Elminage Gothic 3D Remix (3DS, 2013)
    • Elminage Gothic (PC, 2014)
  • Elminage Ibun: Ame no Mihashira (PSP, 2012)
    • Elminage Ibun: Ame no Mihashira Kai (3DS, 2014)

According to Mebius, the console ports of the numbered series will be based on the 3DS versions, with adjustments made for easier playability. The first title is scheduled for release in the early summer in Japan.

While Mebius did not announce which title it plans on porting first, the company held a poll back in May 2024 asking users which Elminage game they would like to see brought back. Elminage II came out on top with an overwhelming 66.9 percent of the votes, followed by Elminage III at 14.4 percent, Elminage Gothic at 10 percent, and Elminage Ibun: Ame no Mihashira at 8.7 percent.

Then, in June 2024, Mebius held another poll asking users which platforms they would like to play Elminage on. Consoles won with 39.8 percent of the votes, followed by at 36.6 percent, and smartphones and handheld game devices at 23.7 percent.
